cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 255 miles SE of the Mouth of the Rio Grande
cyclone.trajectory: Initially drifting north-northeast, then slowing and turning westward this weekend, tracking toward the central-upper Texas coast early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Texas coast (near Matagorda Bay/Freeport area)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Western Gulf Coast from northeastern Mexico through the entire Texas shoreline to southwest Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–50 kt) have a 42% cumulative chance; peak onset chance 12% in roughly 2–3 days with a small (10%) chance of 50-kt gusts.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft surge possible along the upper Texas coast and in Galveston Bay, including Texas City waterfront.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could drop 4–8 inches with isolated higher totals, producing ponding, flash-flooding, and operational delays.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents expected through the weekend; minor coastal flooding possible during high-tide cycles.
